parameters.definition: Maximum number of hours available for production in the factory
Total labor cost limit for production activities
Number of different products to be produced
Cost per hour of labor for the production of each product
Required production time in hours for each product
Profit generated per unit sold of each product
Minimum production goal for each product

description: The factory aims to optimize production within the constraints of a maximum of \param{MaxProductionHours} hours and a labor cost not exceeding \param{LaborCostLimit} dollars. There are \param{NumProducts} products, each with specific labor costs \param{LaborCostPerProduct}, production times \param{ProductionTimePerProduct}, and profit margins \param{ProfitPerProduct}. The production targets for each product are at least \param{MinProductionGoal} units. The objective is to maximize the total profit while adhering to time and cost restrictions.
